meanings.sent1: The excitable puppy wagged its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent2: She is always excitable before a big event.
meanings.sent3: The excitable child couldn't sit still during the movie.
meanings.sent4: Her excitable nature made her a lively addition to the party.
meanings.sent5: The excitable crowd cheered loudly at the concert.

meanings.definition: Capable of being excited or stimulated.
meanings.sent1: The excitable students were eager to learn new things.
meanings.sent2: The excitable plant grew quickly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The excitable cat chased after the moving laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: His excitable imagination led to creative ideas.
meanings.sent5: The excitable puppy's tail wagged at the sound of its owner's voice.

meanings.definition: Prone to sudden outbursts of emotion or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The excitable toddler threw a tantrum in the store.
meanings.sent2: She can be excitable when discussing her favorite topics.
meanings.sent3: The excitable bird chirped loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent4: His excitable nature sometimes leads to impulsive decisions.
meanings.sent5: The excitable dog barked excitedly at the sight of its favorite toy.
